modules.description: The module provides low-level operations for creating and managing 2D plot streams, including drawing shapes, setting colors, defining axes, and handling coordinate transformations, while working with numerical data, graphical parameters, and structures like `plot_t`, `legend_entry_t`, and `colorbar_kind_t`. It enables precise control over visual elements such as line styles, text placement, and color palettes, supporting tasks like scientific visualization and custom plot layouts. Specific use cases include rendering detailed graphical representations, managing legends and colorbars, and configuring complex 2D visualizations with fine-grained adjustments.

Plots 2D data using points, lines, images, functions, and shaded contours with customizable labels, color palettes, and logarithmic scaling. Operates on float arrays and arrays of float arrays to represent coordinates, images, and contour data. Generates visualizations suitable for scientific data analysis and real-time plotting.

Generates 2D and 3D plots using data from arrays and lists, supporting line, scatter, and surface plots. Handles coordinate transformations and axis labeling for scientific visualization. Processes numerical data to produce output in multiple formats including PNG and PDF.

Provides low-level control over 2D plotting through operations like shape drawing, axis definition, and coordinate transformation, using types such as `plot_t`, `legend_entry_t`, and `colorbar_kind_t`. Supports high-level data visualization with functions for points, lines, images, and contours, accepting float arrays for coordinates and data representation. Enables customization of labels, color palettes, and scaling for scientific and real-time plotting. Examples include generating detailed graphs with legends, rendering shaded contours, and configuring logarithmic axes.
